meanings.definition: Not skillful or clever with the hands; clumsy.
meanings.sent1: She felt unhandy when trying to sew a button back on her shirt.
meanings.sent2: The unhandy waiter kept dropping plates as he served the customers.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unhandy of me to attempt juggling with eggs in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His unhandy attempts at painting the fence left streaks of color everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The unhandy carpenter struggled to hammer in a nail straight.

meanings.definition: Not convenient or easy to use; awkward.
meanings.sent1: Carrying a large umbrella on a crowded bus is unhandy.
meanings.sent2: The unhandy layout of the room made it difficult to move around.
meanings.sent3: It was unhandy to have to carry all the groceries in one trip.
meanings.sent4: The unhandy design of the website made it hard to find the information.
meanings.sent5: The unhandy packaging made it challenging to open the box.
